Low energy and changes in mood or motivation are common symptoms of anemia, which is a condition in which the body does not have enough healthy red blood cells.

Feeling low energy for a long time, difficulty sleeping, and changes in mood or motivation are all symptoms of Chronic Fatigue Syndrome, which is a condition that causes extreme fatigue that does not improve with rest.

Low energy, changes in appetite or weight, difficulty sleeping, and changes in mood or motivation are all symptoms of depression, which is a mental health disorder that causes feelings of sadness and hopelessness.
Low energy, no pain or discomfort, and changes in mood or motivation are all symptoms of hypothyroidism, which is a condition in which the thyroid gland does not produce enough thyroid hormone.
